00081   struct AtomStat  {
00082 
00083     public :
00084       int       nAtoms;          // number of atoms in statistics
00085 
00086       realtype  xmin,ymin,zmin;  // minimums of coordinates
00087       realtype  xmax,ymax,zmax;  // maximums of coordinates
00088       realtype  xm  ,ym  ,zm;    // mediums  of coordinates
00089       realtype  xm2 ,ym2 ,zm2;   // square mediums of coordinates
00090 
00091       realtype  occ_min,occ_max; // minimum/maximum occupancy
00092       realtype  occ_m  ,occ_m2;  // medium and square medium occupancy
00093 
00094       realtype  tFmin,tFmax;     // minimum/maximum temperature factor
00095       realtype  tFm  ,tFm2;      // medium and sq. med. temp. factor
00096 
00097       realtype  u11_min,u11_max; // minimums and
00098       realtype  u22_min,u22_max; //   maximums of
00099       realtype  u33_min,u33_max; //     anisotropic
00100       realtype  u12_min,u12_max; //       temperature
00101       realtype  u13_min,u13_max; //         factors
00102       realtype  u23_min,u23_max;
00103 
00104       realtype  u11_m,u11_m2;    // mediums and
00105       realtype  u22_m,u22_m2;    //   square mediums of
00106       realtype  u33_m,u33_m2;    //     anisotropic
00107       realtype  u12_m,u12_m2;    //       temperature
00108       realtype  u13_m,u13_m2;    //         factors
00109       realtype  u23_m,u23_m2;
00110 
00111       word      WhatIsSet;       //   mask field
00112 
00113       void  Init  ();
00114       void  Finish();
00115 
00116       realtype GetMaxSize();
00117 
00118     private :
00119       bool finished;
00120 
00121   };

00192       //    AddBond(...) adds a bond to the atom, that is a pointer
00193       //  to the bonded atom and the bond order. nAdd_bonds allows
00194       //  one to minimize the memory reallocations, if number of
00195       //  bonds is known apriori: Atom adds space for nAdd_bonds
00196       //  if currently allocated space is exchausted.
00197       //    Return:  <=0  - error: bond_atom is already "bonded"
00198       //              >0  - Ok, returns current number of bonds

00280       //   GetChainCalphas(...) is a specialized function for quick
00281       // access to C-alphas of chain which includes given atom.
00282       // This function works faster than an equivalent implementation
00283       // through MMDB's selection procedures.
00284       //    Parameters:
00285       //       Calphas   - array to accept pointers on C-alpha atoms
00286       //                  If Calphas!=NULL, then the function will
00287       //                  delete and re-allocate it. When the array
00288       //                  is no longer needed, the application MUST
00289       //                  delete it:  delete[] Calphas; Deleting
00290       //                  Calphas does not delete atoms from MMDB.
00291       //       nCalphas   - integer to accept number of C-alpha atoms
00292       //                  and the length of Calphas array.
00293       //       altLoc     - alternative location indicator. By default
00294       //                  (""), maximum-occupancy locations are taken.
00295       void  GetChainCalphas ( PPAtom & Calphas, int & nCalphas,
00296                               cpstr altLoc = "" );

00321 
00322       //  GetAtomID(..) generates atom ID in the form
00323       //     /m/c/r(rn).i/n[e]:a
00324       //  where  m  - model number
00325       //         c  - chain ID
00326       //         r  - residue sequence number
00327       //         rn - residue name
00328       //         i  - insertion code
00329       //         n  - atom name
00330       //         e  - chemical element specification
00331       //         a  - alternate location indicator
00332       //  If any of the fields is undefined, it is replaced by
00333       //  hyphen  '-'.
00334       //    No checks on the sufficiency of string buffer AtomID
00335       //  is made.
00336       //    GetAtomID returns AtomID.
00337       pstr  GetAtomID ( pstr AtomID );
00338 
00339       pstr  GetAtomIDfmt ( pstr AtomID );
00340 
00341       // -------  checking atom ID
00342       // CheckID(..) returns 1 if atom is identified, and 0 otherwise.
00343       //   Parameters:
00344       //     aname   - atom name. It may or may not be aligned (as in
00345       //               a PDB file), only first word of the name will
00346       //               be taken ("CA", " CA" and " CA B" are all
00347       //               considered as "CA"). aname may be set to NULL
00348       //               or '*', then this parameter is ignored.
00349       //     elname  - element code. It will work only if element code
00350       //               is supplied (which might not be the case if
00351       //               the atom was created in a tricky way). elname
00352       //               should be used to distinguih between, e.g.
00353       //               "Ca" and "C_alpha"). elname may be set to NULL,
00354       //               or '*', then this parameter is ignored.
00355       //     aloc    - the alternate location code. aloc may be set to
00356       //               NULL or '*', then this parameter is ignored.
00357       //  IMPORTANT: comparison is case-sensitive.
00358       //  The atom is considered as identified, if all non-NULL
00359       //  parameters do match. If all parameters are set NULL, any atom
00360       //  is identified.
00361       //  DEFAULT values correspond to 'any element' and
00362       //                 'no alternate location code'
00363       //  NOTE that " " is not an empty item.
00364       int   CheckID ( const AtomName aname, const Element elname=NULL,
00365                       const AltLoc aloc=pstr("") );
00366 
00367       // CheckIDS(..) works exactly like CheckID(..), but it takes
00368       // the only parameter, the atom ID, which is of the form:
00369       //    {name} {[element]} {:altcode}
00370       // Here {} means that the item may be omitted. Any item may be
00371       // represented by a wildcard '*', which means 'any value'. Just
00372       // absence of an item means 'empty', which makes sense only for
00373       // alternate location code. Missing name or element therefore
00374       // mean 'any name' or 'any element', correspondingly (same as a
00375       // wildcard). There should be no spaces in ID except for leading
00376       // spaces; any following space will terminate parsing.
00377       // The followings are perfectly valid IDs:
00378       //   CA[C]:A     (carbon C_alpha in location A)
00379       //   CA[*]:A     (either C_alpha or Ca in location A)
00380       //   CA:A        (same as above)
00381       //   CA          (either C_alpha or Ca with no location indicator)
00382       //   CA[]        (same as above)
00383       //   CA[C]:      (C_alpha with no location indicator)
00384       //   [C]         (any carbon with no location indicator)
00385       //   [C]:*       (any carbon with any location indicator)
00386       //   *[C]:*      (same as above)
00387       //   :A          (any atom in location A)
00388       //   *[*]:A      (same as above)
00389       //   *[*]:*      (any atom)
00390       //   *           (any atom with no alternate location indicator)
00391       int   CheckIDS ( cpstr ID );
00392 
00393 
00394       // -------  transform coordinates: x := m*x + v
00395       void  Transform     ( mat33 & tm, vect3 & v );
00396       void  Transform     ( mat44 & tm );
00397       void  TransformCopy ( mat44 & tm,
00398                             realtype & xx, realtype & yy, realtype & zz );
00399       void  TransformSet  ( mat44 & tm,
00400                             realtype xx, realtype yy, realtype zz );
00401

00409       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, realtype & rudd );
00410       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, pstr sudd, int maxLen );
00411       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, pstr     & sudd );
00412

00415 
00416       virtual void Copy ( PAtom atom );  // without references in
00417                                           // residues
00418 
00419       void  SetShortBinary();  // leaves only coordinates in binary files
00420       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00421       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00422 
00423     protected :
00424       int       index;   // index in the file
00425       int       nBonds;  // number of bonds in the lowest byte (!)
00426       PAtomBond Bond;    // atom bonds
00427 
00428       void  InitAtom       ();

00430       void  StandardPDBOut ( cpstr Record, pstr S );

00443   enum ALTLOC_FLAG  {
00444     ALF_NoAltCodes    = 0x00000000,
00445     ALF_EmptyAltLoc   = 0x00000001,
00446     ALF_NoEmptyAltLoc = 0x00000002,
00447     ALF_Mess          = 0x00000004,
00448     ALF_Occupancy     = 0x00000008
00449   };

00453     SSE_Strand = 1,
00454     SSE_Bulge  = 2,
00455     SSE_3Turn  = 3,
00456     SSE_4Turn  = 4,
00457     SSE_5Turn  = 5,
00458     SSE_Helix  = 6

00523 
00524       //   GetAltLocations(..) returns the number of different
00525       // alternative locations in nAltLocs, the locations themselves
00526       // - in aLoc and the corresponding occupancies - in occupancy.
00527       //   aLoc and occupancy are allocated dynamically; it is
00528       // responsibility of the application to deallocate aLoc prior
00529       // calling GetAltLocations(..) if they were previously allocated.
00530       // Either, the application is responsible for deallocating aLoc and
00531       // occupancy after use.
00532       //   occupancy[i] may return -1.0 if occupancies were not read
00533       // from coordinate file.
00534       //   alflag returns ALF_NoAltCodes if no alt codes was found,
00535       // otherwise the output is decoded according to bits:
00536       //   ALF_EmptyAltLoc   alternative locations include the
00537       //                     "no alt loc indicator" ("" for
00538       //                     Atom::altLoc).
00539       //                     This means that each atom that has alt locs
00540       //                     different of "", also includes one marked as
00541       //                     "".
00542       //  ALF_NoEmptyAltLoc  alternative locations do not include the
00543       //                     "no alt loc indicator" ("" for
00544       //                     Atom::altLoc).
00545       //                     This means that each atom has either ""
00546       //                     alt loc or at least two alt locs different
00547       //                     of "".
00548       //  ALF_Mess           incorrect residue: it mixes both
00549       //                     ""-including and not-""-including schemes
00550       //  ALF_Occupancy      warning that sum of occupancies for alt
00551       //                     located atoms differ from 1.0 by more
00552       //                     than 0.01.
00553       void  GetAltLocations   ( int & nAltLocs, PAltLoc & aLoc,
00554                                 rvector & occupancy, int & alflag );
00555       int   GetNofAltLocations();
00556 
00557       bool isAminoacid   ();
00558       bool isNucleotide  ();
00559       int  isDNARNA      (); // 0(neither),1(DNA),2(RNA)
00560       bool isSugar       ();
00561       bool isSolvent     ();
00562       bool isModRes      ();
00563       bool isInSelection ( int selHnd );
00564       bool isNTerminus   ();
00565       bool isCTerminus   ();
00566 
00567       // -------  checking residue ID
00568       // CheckID(..) returns 1 if residue is identified, and 0 otherwise.
00569       //   Parameters:
00570       //     sname   - pointer to sequence number; if NULL then ignored.
00571       //     inscode - insertion code; if NULL or '*' then ignored.
00572       //     resname - residue name; if NULL or '*' then ignored.
00573       //  IMPORTANT: comparison is case-sensitive.
00574       //  The residue is considered as identified, if all non-NULL
00575       //  parameters do match. If all parameters are set NULL, any
00576       //  residue is identified.
00577       //  DEFAULT values correspond to 'any residue name' and
00578       //                 'no insertion code'
00579       //  NOTE that " " is not an empty item.
00580       int   CheckID ( int * snum, const InsCode inscode=pstr(""),
00581                       const ResName resname=NULL );
00582 
00583       // CheckIDS(..) works exactly like CheckID(..), but it takes
00584       // the only parameter, the residue ID, which is of the form:
00585       //    {seqnum} {(name)} {.inscode}
00586       // Here {} means that the item may be omitted. Any item may be
00587       // represented by a wildcard '*', which means 'any value'. Just
00588       // absence of a value means 'empty', which is meaningful only for
00589       // the insertion code. Missing sequence number or residue name
00590       // therefore mean 'any sequence number' or 'any residue name',
00591       // correspondingly (same as a wildcard).  There should be no
00592       // spaces in ID except for leading spaces; any following space will
00593       // terminate parsing. The followings are perfectly valid IDs:
00594       //        27(ALA).A   (residue 27A ALA)
00595       //        27().A      (residue 27A)
00596       //        27(*).A     (same as above)
00597       //        27.A        (same as above)
00598       //        27          (residue 27)
00599       //        27().       (same as above)
00600       //        (ALA)       (any ALA without insertion code)
00601       //        (ALA).      (same as above)
00602       //        (ALA).*     (any ALA)
00603       //        *(ALA).*    (any ALA)
00604       //        .A          (any residue with insertion code A)
00605       //        *(*).A      (same as above)
00606       //        *(*).*      (any residue)
00607       //        *           (any residue with no insertion code)
00608       int  CheckIDS ( cpstr ID );
00609 
00610 
00611       //  --------------------  Extracting atoms  ----------------------
00612 
00613       int  GetNumberOfAtoms ();
00614       int  GetNumberOfAtoms ( bool countTers );
00615 
00616       PAtom GetAtom ( const AtomName aname, const Element elname=NULL,
00617                       const AltLoc aloc=cpstr("") );
00618       PAtom GetAtom ( int atomNo );
00619 
00620       void GetAtomTable  ( PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00621 
00622       //   GetAtomTable1(..) returns atom table without TER atoms and
00623       // without NULL atom pointers. NumberOfAtoms returns the actual
00624       // number of atom pointers in atomTable.
00625       //   atomTable is allocated withing the function. If it was
00626       // not set to NULL before calling the function, the latter will
00627       // attempt to deallocate it first.
00628       //   The application is responsible for deleting atomTable,
00629       // however it must not touch atom pointers, i.e. use simply
00630       // "delete[] atomTable;". Never pass atomTable from GetAtomTable()
00631       // into this function, unless you set it to NULL before doing that.
00632       void GetAtomTable1 ( PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00633 
00634 
00635       //  ---------------------  Deleting atoms  -----------------------
00636 
00637       int  DeleteAtom ( const AtomName aname, const Element elname=NULL,
00638                         const AltLoc aloc=cpstr("") );
00639       int  DeleteAtom ( int atomNo );
00640       int  DeleteAllAtoms();
00641 
00642       //   DeleteAltLocs() leaves only alternative location with maximal
00643       // occupancy, if those are equal or unspecified, the one with
00644       // "least" alternative location indicator.
00645       //   The function returns the number of deleted atoms. The atom
00646       // table remains untrimmed, so that nAtoms are wrong until that
00647       // is done. Tables are trimmed by FinishStructEdit() or
00648       // explicitely.
00649       int  DeleteAltLocs ();
00650 
00651       void TrimAtomTable ();
00652 
00653       //  ----------------------  Adding atoms  ------------------------
00654 
00655       //   AddAtom(..) adds atom to the residue. If residue is associated
00656       // with a coordinate hierarchy, and atom 'atm' is not, the latter
00657       // is checked in automatically. If atom 'atm' belongs to any
00658       // coordinate hierarchy (even though that of the residue), it is
00659       // *copied* rather than simply taken over, and is checked in.
00660       //   If residue is not associated with a coordinate hierarchy, all
00661       // added atoms will be checked in automatically once the residue
00662       // is checked in.
00663       int  AddAtom ( PAtom atm );
00664 
00665       //   InsertAtom(..) inserts atom into the specified position of
00666       // the residue. If residue is associated with a coordinate
00667       // hierarchy, and atom 'atm' is not, the latter is checked in
00668       // automatically. If atom 'atm' belongs to any coordinate
00669       // hierarchy (even though that of the residue), it is *copied*
00670       // rather than simply taken over, and is checked in.
00671       //   If residue is not associated with a coordinate hierarchy, all
00672       // added atoms will be checked in automatically once the residue
00673       // is checked in.
00674       int  InsertAtom ( PAtom atm, int position );
00675 
00676       //   This version inserts before the atom with given name. If such
00677       // name is not found, the atom is appended to the end.
00678       int  InsertAtom ( PAtom atm, const AtomName aname );
